meanings.sent1: The stubborn mule jibbed at crossing the bridge.
meanings.sent2: The child jibbed at eating his vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The cat jibbed at wearing a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: She jibbed at the idea of waking up early.
meanings.sent5: The car jibbed at starting in the cold morning.

meanings.sent1: The dancer jibbed across the stage gracefully.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel jibbed up the tree trunk.
meanings.sent3: The toy car jibbed around the corner with a squeak.
meanings.sent4: The leaves jibbed in the wind, creating a rustling sound.
meanings.sent5: The bird jibbed through the air with quick movements.

meanings.definition: Made a sudden movement to avoid something
meanings.sent1: The athlete jibbed to dodge the incoming ball.
meanings.sent2: The rabbit jibbed to avoid the predator.
meanings.sent3: The student jibbed to miss the falling book.
meanings.sent4: She jibbed to sidestep the puddle on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent5: The driver jibbed to swerve away from the oncoming car.
